result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. VanPay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs waived by the Court.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to live in an alcohol free household.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to take all medications as prescribed to him.  The Defendant is to attend all appointments with physicians/treating professionals.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming and/or treatment as recommended.  The Defendant is not to associate with any drug users or drug dealers.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
